timeline.body: I think you need the lock to protect the channel from disconnecting two times. Wouldn't be a `Lock` be better? If `tryLock()` fails the thread would not be blocked. Or is blocking until disconnect what you want to achieve?

replies.bodyText:
Good question. :-)
This is very old code and I don't remember what was the purpose. It seems to be useless as the whole disconnect method is synchronized. I think I was about to remove synchronization from the method and use this channelLock to not lock the whole object, but just disconnect method.
But now I am not sure whether or not it is safe to remove this lock from the code and I would't do this in this PR.
